description: In this series of articles we take a deep dive into a specific detachment for a faction, covering the faction’s rules and upgrades and talking about how to build around that faction for competitive play. In this article, we’re covering the Cult of Magic Detachment for the Thousand Sons. The Thousand Sons had nine cults […]
title: Detachment Focus: Cult of Magic

description: Our resident Ninth Legion player checks out the latest unit choice available to them in Horus Heresy
title: Horus Heresy: Descending from Above with the Sanguinary Guard

description: Unless you’ve been hiding under a rock you should, by now, be aware that the new mission pack, Pariah Nexus, is imminent, releasing in less than two weeks alongside two new Codexes. Given that, the utility of any deep and meaningful insights I could try and draw from this week’s results is limited, which is […]
title: Competitive Innovations in 10th: Leviathan’s Last Orders pt.1

description: Sponge painting often gets relegated to adding texture to terrain, or for doing a bit of quick weathering on tanks, but it can be a valuable tool to all sorts of painting schemes from gritty blanchitsu-esque grimdarkness to helping with fine blending work in high colours. I love sponge painting, and it’s coming close to […]
title: Hobby 101: Sponge Painting

description: John from Can You Roll a Crit? returns this week with a video covering the proposed upcoming buffs and nerfs for the next Balance Dataslate for Kill Team. Using his Q2 tournament stats, he suggests which teams should be buff and nerfed, as well as how!
title: CYRAC: Buffs and Nerfs Need for the June Kill Team Balance Dataslate
